page.title: 01The Yaxham Area
page.content: The area including the parishes of Yaxham & Whimburgh is devoted mainly to agriculture. Here and there are groups of trees,coverts and small ponds, but most of the land is cultivated. Settlements are mainly centred on the villages of Yaxham & Whimburgh & the hamlet of Clint Green. The area has limited local services & facilities apart from a thriving village school at Clint Green which serves primary aged children from the whole area.The River Tud flows east across the area passing through damp meadow land.To the north the land rises towards the main A47 road connecting the Midlands and West Norfolk with Norwich and the East Anglian ports.
